alert.note: Alert for Union (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 11 at 12:20AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...HEAVY RAIN SHOWERS WILL IMPACT UNION COUNTY UNTIL 130 AM EDT... At 1216 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a large shield of moderate rain with embedded heavy rain showers overspreading Union County North Carolina. Rainfall rates were generally one-quarter to one-half inch per hour in the heaviest downpours, and this rain will affect locations that have received from 1 to 3 inches of rain in the past six hours. Locations to be impacted include... Monroe, Indian Trail, Weddington, Stallings, Unionville, Wesley Chapel, Wingate, Waxhaw, Marshville and Lake Park. Deep ponding of water may develop in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Many area streams and creeks are running at elevated levels or near bankfull. Isolated flooding could develop, especially near Bearskin Creek and Beaverdam Creek south of Monroe.
info.instruction: Heavy rainfall may flood areas with poor drainage, such as ditches and underpasses. Avoid these areas and do not cross flooded roads. Water levels of small streams may also rise rapidly. Seek higher ground if threatened by flood waters.
